definition: to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent
(classical particle similar to 於|于[yu2]) in/at/from/because/than/(classical final particle similar to 嗎|吗[ma5], 吧[ba5], 呢[ne5], expressing question, doubt or astonishment)
lit. if you were eating warm shit, it'd be stone cold by the time you finished it (idiom)/fig. (of a person) too slow/can't keep up
pinyin: chi1 shi3 dou1 gan3 bu5 shang4 re4 hu5 de5

sentences.english: Providing warm meals and shelter, especially in the winter months.
sentences.chinese: 提供熱乎的飯菜和住宿地方，尤其是在冬天。

sentences.english: Warm wet plastic came out of the end of the pipe.
sentences.chinese: 管子的出口流出熱乎乎的液體塑料。

sentences.english: Crave sitting in a hot tub with gorgeous gals or guys all over you?
sentences.chinese: 想泡在熱乎乎的浴缸了，左擁右抱美女帥哥？

sentences.english: They signed two agreements that served to warm up the atmosphere of their relations.
sentences.chinese: 他們簽訂了兩個協議，目的是使彼此的關係熱乎起來。
傑克，請喝杯熱乎乎的巧克力飲料吧。

sentences.english: "Chestnuts, hot roast chestnuts, " a peddler cried.
sentences.chinese: “栗子，熱乎乎的烤栗子，”一個小販在叫賣。

sentences.english: It takes an hour or so for some children to warm up to strangers.
sentences.chinese: 有些孩子得過個把小時才能與陌生人熱乎起來。

sentences.english: It seemed a good sign that they're cordially hobnobbing at the first time meeting.
sentences.chinese: 第一次見面他們就談得這麼熱乎，看來是個好兆頭。

sentences.english: Love is like shit, just pull out is hot, too cold for a while.
sentences.chinese: 愛情就像大便，剛拉出來是熱乎的，過壹會兒就涼了。
